Leaves: Egg-shaped to triangular in outline, up to 16 cm long, with shallow lobes and toothed edges.
FruitSeeds: Capsule up to 4 cm long, erect, covered in large, irregular spines, releasing blackish, kidney-shaped, wrinkled seeds.
Habitat: Waste grounds, disturbed areas, riparian areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Spines on the capsule more irregular and flowers shorter than in Common thornapple (*Datura stramonium*).
